page.title: 01BROCKWORTH ,GLOUCESTERSHIRE
page.content: Brockworth is a large village with hills surrounding it. It has seen much development since the 1939-45 war and now has new housing areas,shops,and a large Industrial Estate. There is an old C.E.Church,the tower dating back to Norman times.Brockworth Court nearby shows Tudor architecture. There are two other, modern churches, the United Reformed Church and the Roman Catholic Church. The principal road,Ermin Street,has existed since Roman times,and is a very busy one.Brockworth is situated 8 miles from Cheltenham and 5 miles from Gloucester.Four schools serve the area. The countryside is within easy reach.Local industry provides jobs,but more than half the population commute elsewhere.Shurdington village,half of which lies within this designated area,is included in GR.03920216 area.
